title: (x) Technical paper - custom typeface {Robert Broom (self)}
content: It reminds me Gill's work, except, perhaps, the \_g\_. But it's none of his faces...
author: jmc

comments.content: Perhaps also influenced by [Weiss](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111092548/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/weiss/)? See the M for example. But Weiss doesn't have the funky r.

Yves, I tend to agree with you. That l.c.'r' looks like a rather awkward modification. Does it really look familiar to you? The font is very monotone, and the 'g' doesn't look like it fits well. The closest 'g' I found to that so far has been [David Quay's Titus](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111092548/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/titus-ef/). Not much else about Titus looks close, though. I still haven't found anything else with that 'r'.
